Interactive Setup Wizard for Insper Fonts and Graphics

Source: R/utils.R
setup_insper_fonts.Rd

Interactive guide to set up insperplot with optimal font and graphics device configuration. This function checks your system and provides step-by-step instructions for the best setup.

Usage

setup_insper_fonts(check_only = FALSE)

Arguments

check_only

Logical. If TRUE, only checks current setup without providing interactive guidance. Default is FALSE.

Value

Invisibly returns a list with setup status:

  • fonts_installed: Are Insper fonts installed locally?

  • ragg_installed: Is ragg package installed?

  • setup_complete: Is setup complete and optimal?

Details

This function provides an interactive wizard that:

  1. Checks if Insper fonts (EB Garamond, Barlow) are installed locally

  2. Checks if ragg package is installed

  3. Provides tailored setup instructions based on your system

  4. Guides you to the optimal configuration

**Recommended Setup (Best Performance):**

  1. Install Insper fonts locally from Google Fonts

  2. Install ragg package

  3. Set RStudio graphics backend to AGG

This setup provides:

  • No DPI conflicts

  • No per-session font loading

  • Best rendering quality

  • Optimal performance

See also

check_insper_fonts, use_ragg_device

Other utilities: check_insper_fonts(), format_num_br(), import_insper_fonts(), save_insper_plot(), use_ragg_device()

Examples

# Run interactive setup wizard
setup_insper_fonts()
#> 
#> ── insperplot Setup Wizard ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> 
#> 
#> ── Current Status ──
#> 
#> "x" ~ "Insper fonts installed locally: NO"
#> v
#> " " ~ "Fonts loaded via showtext: NO"
#> 
#> 
#> ── Setup Steps ──
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> ── Step 1: Install Insper Fonts Locally 
#> Primary fonts (recommended):
#> • Georgia - System font (already installed on most systems)
#> • Inter - Download from <https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Inter>
#> 
#> Optional fallback fonts:
#> • EB Garamond - <https://fonts.google.com/specimen/EB+Garamond>
#> • Playfair Display - <https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Playfair+Display>
#> 
#> ℹ After installing, restart R/RStudio and run `check_insper_fonts()` to verify
#> 
#> ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#> 
#> ── Why This Setup? 
#> ✔ No DPI conflicts (unlike showtext)
#> ✔ No per-session font loading overhead
#> ✔ Better rendering quality and performance
#> ✔ Cross-platform consistency
#> ✔ Modern best practice (2025)

# Check current setup status
setup_insper_fonts(check_only = TRUE)
